review_body: Works better on Motorola phone than Google Calendar for notifications. This app pops up individual push notifications that are harder to miss than the ones that come up for Google Calendar. This app could be improved, however, by automatically giving you the option to set a time for a notification. ...Full ReviewWorks better on Motorola phone than Google Calendar for notifications. This app pops up individual push notifications that are harder to miss than the ones that come up for Google Calendar. This app could be improved, however, by automatically giving you the option to set a time for a notification. I have to click too many things to add a notification. Also, if it synced more seamlessly with reminders on Google Calendar and Gmail, that would be helpful.

Great app for managing tasks. A few downsides: 1) Can't see tasks in Google Calendar when accessing from your phone. Makes it hard to schedule. 2) When deleting a re-occuring task your only options are to delete it the one time or every single one of them ever. Just like with calendar events, there ...Full ReviewGreat app for managing tasks. A few downsides: 1) Can't see tasks in Google Calendar when accessing from your phone. Makes it hard to schedule. 2) When deleting a re-occuring task your only options are to delete it the one time or every single one of them ever. Just like with calendar events, there should be an option to only delete future tasks and not remove the past ones completed. 3) Re-occuring tasks don't show up in your task list until the day of, so it's hard to edit re-occuring tasks

Love the app's UX :) clean and straight to the point, pleasing to the eyes. Suggestions: 1. Hope the notifications that would appear on the phone would have more options when the tasl comes up (e.i. move to another time, focus, etc. instead of just mark as done) 2. Wish there was a framework to over...Full ReviewLove the app's UX :) clean and straight to the point, pleasing to the eyes. Suggestions: 1. Hope the notifications that would appear on the phone would have more options when the tasl comes up (e.i. move to another time, focus, etc. instead of just mark as done) 2. Wish there was a framework to oversee the whole tasks for the day from the different 'lists' from work/personal/ etc...to one look at 'my tasks' or things to do today... If I'm not mistaken that these are not yet incorporated. :)

3 features that would make me move from Todoist: 1. A cleaner interface for "today" list so that once today's items are done, can look blank, gives great feeling of completion. 2. Ability to set a recurring due date based on completion rather than a set rhythm, e.g. if I set repeat on Monday but I w...Full Review3 features that would make me move from Todoist: 1. A cleaner interface for "today" list so that once today's items are done, can look blank, gives great feeling of completion. 2. Ability to set a recurring due date based on completion rather than a set rhythm, e.g. if I set repeat on Monday but I want it done every 7 days and I actually do it Tuesday, have the next occurrence on Tuesday. 3. Three or four levels of priorities within a list.

The widget is beautiful and simple. I like having a list of things to do to look at whenever I have free time. But it's silly that you can't sync the task times with the Google calendar app. Tasks need to be merged as Reminders in Google Calendar, or the Task calendar needs to be available in the Ap...Full ReviewThe widget is beautiful and simple. I like having a list of things to do to look at whenever I have free time. But it's silly that you can't sync the task times with the Google calendar app. Tasks need to be merged as Reminders in Google Calendar, or the Task calendar needs to be available in the App version of Google Calendar.

It boggles my mind that the tasks created in the app STILL don't sync with the Google Calendar on the Android device. As much as I'd love to use this app, until this is made possible, I'm stuck with creating tasks in Google Keep, whose remindes (again, mind-bogglingly) DO sync with both Google Calen...Full ReviewIt boggles my mind that the tasks created in the app STILL don't sync with the Google Calendar on the Android device. As much as I'd love to use this app, until this is made possible, I'm stuck with creating tasks in Google Keep, whose remindes (again, mind-bogglingly) DO sync with both Google Calendars (meaning the web version and the Android version).

Getting more and more into this app, but it still needs a few extra features, such as being able to share ones's to-do list with other apps, etc. I'd also like to see a prioritizing feature so that to-do lists/items can be ordered according to their relevance and importance, other than simply being ...Full ReviewGetting more and more into this app, but it still needs a few extra features, such as being able to share ones's to-do list with other apps, etc. I'd also like to see a prioritizing feature so that to-do lists/items can be ordered according to their relevance and importance, other than simply being dragged to the top of one's list, which is only way to currently prioritize items. Maybe colour coded or a starring system introduced. Hope this is useful for potential future updates.

It used to be better. They got rid of multiple layers of nesting, which I used all the time. The new version "helpfully" offers to corrupt your old data. The fact that tasks disappear instead of getting checked is also a major downgrade. The completed tasks view seems to place tasks in random order,...Full ReviewIt used to be better. They got rid of multiple layers of nesting, which I used all the time. The new version "helpfully" offers to corrupt your old data. The fact that tasks disappear instead of getting checked is also a major downgrade. The completed tasks view seems to place tasks in random order, and so there's no clear way to see what I did each day. (Also, on desktop the new keyboard shortcuts are absolutely terrible.) Multi-account support is also broken: if you "share" (eg: a web page) to Tasks it places the task in whatever Google account you'd last used in the Tasks app, and there's no way to move a task from one account to another. So you end up with work tasks in your personal task list and vice-versa.

The app is great, but would like a few more features. Ability to sync with calendar, reminders, and have more sublists. Either way, the app is very satisfying. I just go back and forth between this and keep notes, which has more features. But this is great for simple daily task lists

I'm only using Google Tasks because other task apps don't fire notifications properly using Android Beta 3. However, GT has a MAJOR flaw that makes it uncomfortable to use. Repeat tasks do not show up until the next due date after completing the last one. In fact, the task may not show up until some...Full ReviewI'm only using Google Tasks because other task apps don't fire notifications properly using Android Beta 3. However, GT has a MAJOR flaw that makes it uncomfortable to use. Repeat tasks do not show up until the next due date after completing the last one. In fact, the task may not show up until some random time the day it's due. Pretty scary to use; doesn't feel reliable. Future tasks DO show up properly using the calendar app in Chrome on my PC. Please extend that function to Android!

This app is good for listing minor unimportant tasks. Using this for any important tasks can be a proplem because there is no pop up reminder that lets you know the task is coming up. You have to manually check to see what tasks need to be done, which if you have the time to continually check your l...Full ReviewThis app is good for listing minor unimportant tasks. Using this for any important tasks can be a proplem because there is no pop up reminder that lets you know the task is coming up. You have to manually check to see what tasks need to be done, which if you have the time to continually check your list it works. However, if your busy doing something and an important task needs to be done you will fail to complete it because there was no alert outside the app to let you know it is coming up.

For me, there should be a way to sort completed tasks alphabetically this is particularly important for repetitive tasks like groceries where you buy the same things over and over again. I like to go to the completed tasks and just tap on the grocery items that I need now. But it's too difficult to ...Full ReviewFor me, there should be a way to sort completed tasks alphabetically this is particularly important for repetitive tasks like groceries where you buy the same things over and over again. I like to go to the completed tasks and just tap on the grocery items that I need now. But it's too difficult to find what I'm looking for in my lengthy unsorted list. If the list were sorted alphabetically I would be able to find items quickly.

It's great! It's really simple, and I love it, certainly it's way too simple... There should be some "Advanced features" to customize some options/features. It would be awesome if it could be integrated with Google Calendar. Maybe the SubTasks could follow the same due date (Makes sense to me and I ...Full ReviewIt's great! It's really simple, and I love it, certainly it's way too simple... There should be some "Advanced features" to customize some options/features. It would be awesome if it could be integrated with Google Calendar. Maybe the SubTasks could follow the same due date (Makes sense to me and I bet also other users/potential users).

Good clean interface. But it still feels like the bare bones of a good task management app. There should be an option to see all tasks across lists together. I think this is a pretty basic requirement. This functionality shoud have been ready when the ability to create lists is introduced. Takes so ...Full ReviewGood clean interface. But it still feels like the bare bones of a good task management app. There should be an option to see all tasks across lists together. I think this is a pretty basic requirement. This functionality shoud have been ready when the ability to create lists is introduced. Takes so much time to load these lists too. Such a hassle. Should one wait for this in hopes that it will be heard or look for alternate options. I don't know. For now I'm hoping and waiting.

Cant do without. Syncs seamlessly with my gmail, shows up in my sideview. While looking a my laptop I can simultaneously see things I'm adding to my list while on my cell phone. I cant go shopping without it. And I can easily jot down random to do tasks as I think of them instead of scrambling to fi...Full ReviewCant do without. Syncs seamlessly with my gmail, shows up in my sideview. While looking a my laptop I can simultaneously see things I'm adding to my list while on my cell phone. I cant go shopping without it. And I can easily jot down random to do tasks as I think of them instead of scrambling to find a scrap of paper so I don't forget.

It's a little bit confusing at first but you get used to it. For improvement it could have some pre-defined lists like short-term and long-term lists, or today's list. Also it could use labels in addition to lists, as what's designed for google contacts. In lack of labels, you have to assign each ta...Full ReviewIt's a little bit confusing at first but you get used to it. For improvement it could have some pre-defined lists like short-term and long-term lists, or today's list. Also it could use labels in addition to lists, as what's designed for google contacts. In lack of labels, you have to assign each task to only one category and this can't help covering all the user's needs.

Great! But overly simple. Needs a serious overhaul with many needed bells and whistles added. One example could be a Location Reminder ability. This capability is a function that is already in the Google Keep app. Just add that bit of code from Google Keep to Google Tasks and voila. Though you could...Full ReviewGreat! But overly simple. Needs a serious overhaul with many needed bells and whistles added. One example could be a Location Reminder ability. This capability is a function that is already in the Google Keep app. Just add that bit of code from Google Keep to Google Tasks and voila. Though you could make one change to that bit of code. It would be extremely useful if a user could set up a text that would auto-send when a specified gps-fence set up for that reminder had been breached. TBW.

Wonderful app and really helps me avoid the bulk of carrying journals everywhere. I have adult ADD and task-keeping has always been a challenge. I use Tasks a lot because I can jot down ideas, set reminders, categorize, and check things off. I use my G-calendar all the time, so this keeps everything...Full ReviewWonderful app and really helps me avoid the bulk of carrying journals everywhere. I have adult ADD and task-keeping has always been a challenge. I use Tasks a lot because I can jot down ideas, set reminders, categorize, and check things off. I use my G-calendar all the time, so this keeps everything on one device. And syncs everything in one. My only recommendations are to have colored options, priority indicators, and ability to list by priority, etc. vs having to manually organize tasks.

The app is fine and I was glad to find that it's part of the G Suite, so I can sync my Reminders from Calendar. Just 2 suggestions: may you please add features so that the tasks I add on my PC in Calendar appear here? Also, please upgrade this app for teachers/students to be able to plan & organise ...Full ReviewThe app is fine and I was glad to find that it's part of the G Suite, so I can sync my Reminders from Calendar. Just 2 suggestions: may you please add features so that the tasks I add on my PC in Calendar appear here? Also, please upgrade this app for teachers/students to be able to plan & organise lessons/hmwk better. Otherwise, the Tasks app becomes unnecessary & I'll download another, broader, one. Thnx in advance!

I think this app is great. The ability to make tasks from email is indispensable. Two potential areas of improvement include: 1) ability to see an "all tasks" option which shows all the tasks from the different lists and 2) enable the widget to sort tasks by due date. If Google were to do this, I wo...Full ReviewI think this app is great. The ability to make tasks from email is indispensable. Two potential areas of improvement include: 1) ability to see an "all tasks" option which shows all the tasks from the different lists and 2) enable the widget to sort tasks by due date. If Google were to do this, I would up my ranking to five stars.

As someone with ADD/ADHD, this app is great for me. I can mark things down that I want to remember and then set a time so that the app will display a notification. This allows me to keep my focus on where I want at a certain time without fearing that I'll forget the thing that popped into my brain.

I am trying to use Tasks for all my routine and current project next actions. I like how you can set reminders and how you can drag items in the order you want them, as well as nest them. I really like the simple checkbox feature. I do not like that you cannot delete the Default list. I'd also like ...Full ReviewI am trying to use Tasks for all my routine and current project next actions. I like how you can set reminders and how you can drag items in the order you want them, as well as nest them. I really like the simple checkbox feature. I do not like that you cannot delete the Default list. I'd also like to re-arrange lists (like you can drag items within a list). And I'd like for there to be an advanced function of selecting several things from disparate lists to make a "today" to do list. Thanks!

Pretty good! I would prefer to be able to use it directly in gcal, like it works in the browser version. I always click the calendar and want to select the time before writing my task, it's just the way we're used to doing like in many other calendar apps, but Tasks is different

Syncing and streamlining? FLAWLESS. I love using the widgets on Android so I can see the tasks for all my lists and accounts at the same time. However, there are a few possible improvements: 1) I wish I could share my tasks from one Google account to the next, for teamwork and personal efficiency re...Full ReviewSyncing and streamlining? FLAWLESS. I love using the widgets on Android so I can see the tasks for all my lists and accounts at the same time. However, there are a few possible improvements: 1) I wish I could share my tasks from one Google account to the next, for teamwork and personal efficiency reasons. 2) Google Tasks may benefit from adding a few of the features of Asana, like assigning tasks as well, or a postpone button. 3) I also wish tasks could use voice, & location based reminders.

Generally plan my whole life on this app and love its utility. My only suggestions would be enabling a shortcut for creating multiple tasks on the same day (like on desktop, where you hit enter from a task that already has a date), and grouping subtasks together more intuitively (i.e., checking the ...Full ReviewGenerally plan my whole life on this app and love its utility. My only suggestions would be enabling a shortcut for creating multiple tasks on the same day (like on desktop, where you hit enter from a task that already has a date), and grouping subtasks together more intuitively (i.e., checking the parent task gets rid of all subtasks, all have the same date as the parent task by default).

A nice, simple enough To Do List app that still gives you decent options for organizing and sorting through your obligations. Feels and operates how you expect a Google product will. Not a project management tool, in that it wouldn't be great at tracking your progress on things, but you could just e...Full ReviewA nice, simple enough To Do List app that still gives you decent options for organizing and sorting through your obligations. Feels and operates how you expect a Google product will. Not a project management tool, in that it wouldn't be great at tracking your progress on things, but you could just enter a description for yourself in each task that says, 'When this is done, make a new Task for [next step]'.

This is an amazing app. I use it everyday. Why one star? Because Google Assistant doesn't have support... And it is the one piece of my 100% Nest/Google Smart Home that drives me up a wall. Reminders and tasks have different purposes, and I wish my Google Assistant (literally) understood that.

It's a great idea to have tasks separate from everything else to help keep from other distractions. I put the widget on my home screen on my phone so I see it every time I unlock my phone. However I think there needs to be a few improvements. I need dark mode on that widget, and a slider to configur...Full ReviewIt's a great idea to have tasks separate from everything else to help keep from other distractions. I put the widget on my home screen on my phone so I see it every time I unlock my phone. However I think there needs to be a few improvements. I need dark mode on that widget, and a slider to configure transparency of the background of the widget so that it integrates with my background image. I would also like to see better integration with Google calendar. Like with recurring reminders.

Great start. Good interface, intuitive design. Would love a few features: 1. Option to view all tasks from different lists in one location/page. Ability to order via date. Maybe a page for 'today', 'this week' etc. 2. Further integration with Google calendar - option to view tasks with a time can be...Full ReviewGreat start. Good interface, intuitive design. Would love a few features: 1. Option to view all tasks from different lists in one location/page. Ability to order via date. Maybe a page for 'today', 'this week' etc. 2. Further integration with Google calendar - option to view tasks with a time can be viewed on calendar schedule - like an 'event' or under an event 3. Heading/sections in lists to seperate tasks

I just switched from Toodledo as the new Toodledo owners seem to be disorganised and struggling. I was concerned that Google Tasks is too essential and it wouldn't have enough features. (Priority, Tags, Location, Specialized recurring dates (every 2nd month etc.). But I've found by using multiple li...Full ReviewI just switched from Toodledo as the new Toodledo owners seem to be disorganised and struggling. I was concerned that Google Tasks is too essential and it wouldn't have enough features. (Priority, Tags, Location, Specialized recurring dates (every 2nd month etc.). But I've found by using multiple lists and the "Full Screen for Google Tasks" extension, I have been able to make it work. And since I mainly use it to keep myself organised, Toodledo was overkill. I love the integration with Gmail and Calendar.

What I would expect. Better than Outlook which does NOT support a task list on the Outlook mobile app! (Dumb dumb dumb) Plus.... you can access your Google email, contacts, task list, AND calendar, from any computer you log into. Including all Googme apps like photos, files, videos, etc. Can't beat ...Full ReviewWhat I would expect. Better than Outlook which does NOT support a task list on the Outlook mobile app! (Dumb dumb dumb) Plus.... you can access your Google email, contacts, task list, AND calendar, from any computer you log into. Including all Googme apps like photos, files, videos, etc. Can't beat that!

I love that I can integrate my Google Reminders and Google Tasks with my Google Calendar! That's critical! So bravo to Google for that! But I don't like (1) that I can't alphabetically sort my Task lists, (2) that my mobile Google Calendar doesn't show Tasks at all (yes, there's a mobile Google Task...Full ReviewI love that I can integrate my Google Reminders and Google Tasks with my Google Calendar! That's critical! So bravo to Google for that! But I don't like (1) that I can't alphabetically sort my Task lists, (2) that my mobile Google Calendar doesn't show Tasks at all (yes, there's a mobile Google Tasks app, but being able to see Reminders and Tasks in my mobile Calendar is critical for good productivity). Fix these two BIG issues and I will upgrade my rating from 3 to 5. Just say'n.

This app is super simple and quick to use. It has the option to add more details about tasks and set a time and date for them to be completed by. You can also create separate lists and create sublists within tasks. Overall a great app that does all I need it to!

Fairly simple and straightforward. Screen doesn't rotate on my tablet from portrait to landscape when I use a keyboard with my tablet. App remains in portrait mode, meaning it's appearance is sideways as I type. Not the end of the world, but less then first class for Google.

The biggest thing missing is collaborators. After that, one more level of subtasks would be fantastic. An equally nice option would be to have repeating tasks that are able to have subtasks. Everything that is in the app already pretty much hits on exactly what you would want in a checklist app

Tasks doesn't just mean stuff a user needs to do. It has a lot of other contexts as well - lists of items to remember for later, things to take when packing for a trip, places to visit, things to research, grocery items that need to be remembered. Consider these use cases please rather than the myop...Full ReviewTasks doesn't just mean stuff a user needs to do. It has a lot of other contexts as well - lists of items to remember for later, things to take when packing for a trip, places to visit, things to research, grocery items that need to be remembered. Consider these use cases please rather than the myopic one you currently do and please update features and language.

App Version: Specifically the widget. I recommend adding the *option* to have the widget as "view only" so that you can view tasks but not accidentally check them off as you swipe through the screens of your phone. Desktop Version: Allow the Gmail Tasks bar to expand to fill more than 20% of the scr...Full ReviewApp Version: Specifically the widget. I recommend adding the *option* to have the widget as "view only" so that you can view tasks but not accidentally check them off as you swipe through the screens of your phone. Desktop Version: Allow the Gmail Tasks bar to expand to fill more than 20% of the screen. A lot more. Like half. Or the whole thing. Either that or bring back the full screen tasks.

I can create lists for everything, set reoccurring tasks and set reminders and due dates on certain tasks. I can move items from one task list to another to group similar tasks. I love that I can pull a task out of the completed task list to save time rather than create a new identical task. Very we...Full ReviewI can create lists for everything, set reoccurring tasks and set reminders and due dates on certain tasks. I can move items from one task list to another to group similar tasks. I love that I can pull a task out of the completed task list to save time rather than create a new identical task. Very well thought out and simple to use. Overall this is my favorite task list app ever!

I'd give it a 5 if I could only have one thing. The ability to make a couple basic lists. That'd be BEYOND PERFECT (hint-hint). I love the ease of creating tasks, and then further defining the task is great! As easy to use as it was to learn to use. Highly recommend this app to anyone looking for a ...Full ReviewI'd give it a 5 if I could only have one thing. The ability to make a couple basic lists. That'd be BEYOND PERFECT (hint-hint). I love the ease of creating tasks, and then further defining the task is great! As easy to use as it was to learn to use. Highly recommend this app to anyone looking for a super simple list maker/organizer.

Has potential to be improved greatly by adding collaboration features. Specifically, need to add ability to assign a team to a task list, assign a specific task to one of the team members with ability by assigned owner to update status, send auto generated reports on task list to team members etc.

Can't change starting day of the week. Can't change list order. In sort by date mode: Please make the subtasks graphical, enable reordering, move the repeating icon next to the task and show time. Some repeating tasks disappear and some (?) appear again, they're not in Completed. Please make it so t...Full ReviewCan't change starting day of the week. Can't change list order. In sort by date mode: Please make the subtasks graphical, enable reordering, move the repeating icon next to the task and show time. Some repeating tasks disappear and some (?) appear again, they're not in Completed. Please make it so the order of repeating non-timed tasks (when finished and appearing again) doesn't change. Please add a today and timed section, one for all lists, and an option to make the notifications sticky.

Just started looking at the app really. It's a little unclear on list title and to listing the tasks for that title. Also maybe I just need to play around a bit more but it doesn't seem to have a bulletin or enter key for the next task to go down. It could be because I'm in details for the task but ...Full ReviewJust started looking at the app really. It's a little unclear on list title and to listing the tasks for that title. Also maybe I just need to play around a bit more but it doesn't seem to have a bulletin or enter key for the next task to go down. It could be because I'm in details for the task but even so details I should be able to jot points down?

Works. Great integration with Goggle Calendar on web app, but really needs it here. 5 stars when that happens. Why important? Time blocking. Put an event that spans 2 hours in your Calendar, drag your Tasks over that event. Different colors. So easy conceptually.

Good app. Requesting few improvements 1. User should able to move task from one list to another 2. User should able to duplicate his selected tasks in other lists then he can able to change different target dates for them 3. In task details user should able to attach images, audio or video 4. List c...Full ReviewGood app. Requesting few improvements 1. User should able to move task from one list to another 2. User should able to duplicate his selected tasks in other lists then he can able to change different target dates for them 3. In task details user should able to attach images, audio or video 4. List can have sub list 5. User should able to assign the task to other user. Thanks if these features are included in this app.

Reliable list manager which synchronises easily with other family members, so we can all see what's needed to be done(packing lists for holidays etc.). Could do with an easier date "to do by" section and sorting of lists could be more expansive, such as alphabetically, by date needed and by date add...Full ReviewReliable list manager which synchronises easily with other family members, so we can all see what's needed to be done(packing lists for holidays etc.). Could do with an easier date "to do by" section and sorting of lists could be more expansive, such as alphabetically, by date needed and by date added. Other than that, great app

I think it was 'calendar' first that infused in me an idea to track down my reminders and pending tasks periodically and since I have started using Tasks, the same experience-to-change has further ignited and enriched to a certain extent. I think that People should not only see dates in calendars bu...Full ReviewI think it was 'calendar' first that infused in me an idea to track down my reminders and pending tasks periodically and since I have started using Tasks, the same experience-to-change has further ignited and enriched to a certain extent. I think that People should not only see dates in calendars but they must put themselves to various rigorous imprisonment to subdue criminal activities n behaviour. There may have been missed opportunities earlier but the clock pendulum is finally oscillating.

Web app has integration with calendar and gmail whereas android app is just a basic tasks only version. Why would there be no interaction between gmail app, calendar app and tasks app on the phone as well? Google always talks of making things simpler, why would you miss out of these things for mobil...Full ReviewWeb app has integration with calendar and gmail whereas android app is just a basic tasks only version. Why would there be no interaction between gmail app, calendar app and tasks app on the phone as well? Google always talks of making things simpler, why would you miss out of these things for mobile app then? The sub tasks such have a nested view, its quite confusing as there is no nested view. Also there should be a a button to set priority level for task.

So I want to store using Google Calendar and Tasks. I would give this five stars if there was a way to view tasks in Calendar. I've tried looking up ways on the internet to perform this but nothing is working. I have both apps, but they don't appear to sync.

Very user friendly! It would be cool to have other options like a grid-style to do list (for example I have the same ten tasks with respect to seven different students, so it would be cool to have a grid of task v student and be able to fill in the grid as I complete the tasks rather than making sep...Full ReviewVery user friendly! It would be cool to have other options like a grid-style to do list (for example I have the same ten tasks with respect to seven different students, so it would be cool to have a grid of task v student and be able to fill in the grid as I complete the tasks rather than making separate pages for a task list per student)

Can't function at work without this app. The Gmail integration is amazing as you can create tasks straight from an email and later click to see the associated email with the task. I wish the add to tasks button wasn't buried in a weird menu and it was an actual prominent button like spam or archive.

Integrates seamlessly with Google Calendar. I wish I could see my tasks in one list on the given day instead of having to open each list separately. Otherwise, I find this app far superior to all the other free apps built to sync with Google Tasks.

My favourite featues: It's simple, intuitive, you can create subtasks, export to Google Keep, multiple lists, and arrange by date or custom. You can even mark emails in Gmail as a task (love that feature). I've tried many to do apps and this one just works great!

I like its simplicity, fast loading and integration to google platform and calendar. What i miss: >Tags (highest priority) >shortcut key to notification bar >Attachment option. Hope will google can take care. I don't want to download another app for the overlapping services.

I wish that it would rotate to landscape mode. If I set a task for every 3 weeks, but I don't mark it done the day it's due, the next instance is on the wrong week. I'd like it to be every X weeks starting from the start date, regardless of when I mark it done. Recurring tasks disappear when I check...Full ReviewI wish that it would rotate to landscape mode. If I set a task for every 3 weeks, but I don't mark it done the day it's due, the next instance is on the wrong week. I'd like it to be every X weeks starting from the start date, regardless of when I mark it done. Recurring tasks disappear when I check them off. They only show up when they notify me the next time. When a task is done, I want to see the next instance with the next due date so that I can plan ahead. I like the interface and subtasks.

I switched from another list app that is going away. I like that it imported reminders from my calendar. I wish when adding things to a list it left the area opened to type in, instead of having to click the plus sign every time I want to add another thing to my grocery list

Dramatically better than all the previous pitiful task options google offered in the past, so great job, but lack of widget themes and options makes it bad. I may keep it for the quick items, but for any serious task management it's a bit of a bust. 2/20/2020 Updated comments: You can create repeating tasks, but once you complete one the first time you can't see it in the task list view until the next day due actually arrives. You can see future repeats if you use agenda calendar view on the web, however; you can't hide completed tasks in the agenda view. Also, you can't filter out individual task lists on the web agenda view (all or nothing). My biggest issue is you can't set a priority level on a task. I try and use the time of day to set priorities, but that's a bit clumsy. I'm retired now and I only need to use it for personal stuff. No way I could use this for professional purposes. I continue to use it because it's free and, of course, always is in sync.

This product has great potential but must make a few adjustments. 1) The widget should sort tasks by date, allow for day, week views and across all lists. 2) Future repeating tasks are only visible on the Google Calendar, not the app. They only show up in the app the day they are due, which doesn't ...Full ReviewThis product has great potential but must make a few adjustments. 1) The widget should sort tasks by date, allow for day, week views and across all lists. 2) Future repeating tasks are only visible on the Google Calendar, not the app. They only show up in the app the day they are due, which doesn't give you much time for planning. Let me know when these are fixed and I'll give it another try, for now it is not very useful.

The reminder system also leaves much to be desired, I rarely get notifications on what I need to do, much less at good times. I just have to check the app frequently to make sure I'm not forgetting a...Full ReviewGreat for keeping track of what needs to be done! I just wish it would connect with Google calendar. The reminder system also leaves much to be desired, I rarely get notifications on what I need to do, much less at good times. I just have to check the app frequently to make sure I'm not forgetting anything.

Taska are my personal life companion reminding me what to do, how to think, how to set my mind and what to say hour by hours. I love the occurancea option: I create a task in a minute and it keeps me on track for years to come. I even schedule my prayers on it and it reminds when and what I say in m...Full ReviewTaska are my personal life companion reminding me what to do, how to think, how to set my mind and what to say hour by hours. I love the occurancea option: I create a task in a minute and it keeps me on track for years to come. I even schedule my prayers on it and it reminds when and what I say in my prayer. It is just a great app!

This app is simple but useful. It keeps me on track and is accessible through many google applications. As a person with ADHD, finding a system for reminders that works for me has been really difficult, but this app keeps me on top of it.

Very useful. Feature request: It would be even better if it integrated with Gmail and Comments from Docs and calendar natively rather than using something like zapier or ifttt. Feature request:. A snooze feature so the disappeared or dropped to the bottom of the current list would be awesome.

It's a little disorganized. If I make subtasks they aren't nested within the main task they're out in the open with all the rest of the tasks. This is very confusing from a glance perspective because I only have a snippet of information related to the main task which I don't see because it's just ou...Full ReviewIt's a little disorganized. If I make subtasks they aren't nested within the main task they're out in the open with all the rest of the tasks. This is very confusing from a glance perspective because I only have a snippet of information related to the main task which I don't see because it's just out in the open.

Very helpful to keep your day organised and good reminder to do the tasks you set to do. The app is simple to use and clean. Its not too complex, that's what I like about it. However, I wish it could complete my tasks for me 🙄. Unfortunately that's upto us whether we do the set task or not 😂😉.

This can be a lot better. It needs to have calendar integration in mobile... Not just desktop. It needs persistent notifications for tasks that need to be done. Needs a better system for multiple account on android and the way notifications work. Needs more features.

Great todo app. Needs some furthur feature improvements like the ability to see recurring tasks before they are scheduled, sort by date, time, etc. One of the only todo apps that will send a new reminder for a daily task regardless of whether you completed it the day before.
Very useful, simple to use
Excellent app. I don't forget anything anymore.
Downloaded this to help with my procrastination. I'm yet to open the app. (Downloaded weeks ago, not the apps fault. Sure it's better then a 3 star)

Being able to have tasks across all devices is very nice. It lacks functionality for shared tasks however. As a G Suite user, this would be very helpful. Also, being able to "pin" critical tasks to the top would be a great feature.

Good, clean and simple to do list app. The only thing I wish it had was the ability to mark daily repeating tasks as complete after the day has ended, and to look back at a particular day and see what tasks you completed on that date.

Google tasks doesn't place your tasks on the Google calendar if you're using the app on your phone. However, if you're using this app on your computer it will appear, if you've assigned the task to a date and time using your phone. You will be notified of any assigned task's on your phone that you'v...Full ReviewGoogle tasks doesn't place your tasks on the Google calendar if you're using the app on your phone. However, if you're using this app on your computer it will appear, if you've assigned the task to a date and time using your phone. You will be notified of any assigned task's on your phone that you've created on your computer or phone if it's been assigned with a task date and time.

It's a great way for me to keep my list organized. If it needs any improvements at all it would be a feature that allows you to add subtasks by simply typing a task and drag/drop to the overarching task, but even as it is it works great.

I really love how minimalist this app is. It helps me maintain a very organized set of to-do lists in my everyday life. I do hope it can integrate with Google Assistant so that I can add something to the list of tasks via voice command.

Really helpful, with some small quirks. The biggest quirk is that the mobile calendar experience doesn't match the desktop one, so even though you'd expect to see your tasks integrate with Google calendar on your phone... They don't. Not a huge deal though 🤷‍♂️

It's ok as a simple task list but the lack of integration with Google calendar on Android means I'm still using Reminders for Calendar and Keep over this. I've also had a few instances where reminder notifications did not occur at their scheduled time because I hadn't opened the app that day yet. So...Full ReviewIt's ok as a simple task list but the lack of integration with Google calendar on Android means I'm still using Reminders for Calendar and Keep over this. I've also had a few instances where reminder notifications did not occur at their scheduled time because I hadn't opened the app that day yet. So it's only ok for tasks that don't actually have a specific date or time deadline.
Simple put. I'm going to do is just think about the task you can do next and it goes great with the reminders.
Great app. Very useful and easy to use
Like it, is there a way to reorder the lists(not their contents)?
Quite convenient. Use it for work and to track where I am now.
Easy and syncs great. Practical

Sloppy user interface. Otherwise works great, BUT only in Google calendar on my PC. Tasks do not show on my phone. I had been using "Ultimate To-Do List", but switched because it was "Google". Wish I hadn't.

This has been great. Perfect for chores, one-offs or shopping lists. I like the simple, intuitive interface. I wish there was a way to create a shared list, so I could let someone else push shopping items into my list. Like the way I can share a Google Calendar.

This app helps me stay on top of the assignments that I need to do. I like that I can sync it across my devices. This allows for a quick reference on my phone when needed. This has been my savior in regards to keeping up with assignments, due dates, and forms needed on this journey through nursing s...Full ReviewThis app helps me stay on top of the assignments that I need to do. I like that I can sync it across my devices. This allows for a quick reference on my phone when needed. This has been my savior in regards to keeping up with assignments, due dates, and forms needed on this journey through nursing school.

It's still not enough to convince me to use this for my to do list instead of Keep. The only edge it has is perhaps the ability to integrate it with Calendar. The larger widget on Keep is far more convenient than this one. Maybe just integrate this with Keep instead??

I've reviewed over 25 to-do and task apps. - I never gave Google Tasks a thoughtt believing it to be simplistic. Appears Google has updated the app software. Turns out now it has all the functionality I always needed. Can't beat the price either - Thanks, Google.

App allows you to keep multiple lists. The app allows you setup reminders in Google calendars, which comes in handy. Biggest complaint is that it doesn't work with Google Assistant. That is why I only gave 3 stars instead of 5.

Simple and easy to use. But definitely gets lost in the plethora of Google apps... Can this tie into my calendar? Can these be reminders? Sharing a list would be a great feature too. Overall, works for what it's built for but has way more potential.

It does what it has to do, if I could change anything it would be the notifications. They can fly easily under the radar. Also the list design when you drag from the bottom. It works but makes it harder en less sleek in my opinion.

I would love if we could change the order of the lists the way we wanted. At the moment it's either order of creation or alphabetical, which doesn't help much. It would also be nice to change the color of the list titles or the items themselves!

Interface is way too simplistic, some of the core features that one expects from a task management app such as being able to set a recurring tasks, better grouping of the tasks are missing. But otherwise it's a very good app.
It's a great way to manage my tasks and time. Love it
Simply to use, no clutter, fab!

author_name: m i c a e l
review_body: Super love it. Keep improving please.

Please add more features that allow for everyday reminders. The task get all out of order when you complete them . I want to use mine everyday but it makes it hard to. Plus the screen where you see all the lists should be able to be alphabetical, numbered, or customizable.

I love the integration with calendar, but this tool needs to be suped up more! More integration with Keep, more integration with Calendar, better notifications! More functionality! Please Google devs! You are on to something powerful! I thank all of you for your hard work!

This app has been my everyday use app for managing and reminding me of my daily task. I just wish I could have the option to drag the most important list on top of the lists i have and could set an alarm as a reminder. That would be helpful.

I am finding Google Tasks very useful. It has helped me from not missing some very important appointments. I have only one issue, it doesn't display the time, you have to select the task to see the time of the task.

Very useful. I wish it had more flexibility to reorder lists. I wish I could search my tasks so that I don't have to spend so much time hunting for them. The best parts are the portability between devices and integration into Google Calendar.
A wonderful app for managing daily tasks.
Super handy for short term task like home work.
Absolutely love the simplicity of this app.
Great, pretty, easy to use.
I really don't like the appearance . Everyother tasks app looks way better than this
I can't reach my tasks on my cellphone because it can't synchronise the data.

Update: even after the most recent update it still does not notify on my phone when tasks are due. The app is basically useless if notifications do not work. Used to be great. But in last few days it had stopped giving reminders when things are due. Only way reminders go off is when you open the app...Full ReviewUpdate: even after the most recent update it still does not notify on my phone when tasks are due. The app is basically useless if notifications do not work. Used to be great. But in last few days it had stopped giving reminders when things are due. Only way reminders go off is when you open the app.

Disappointing, I don't get notifications most of the time unless I open the app, even when I've already set a time. I was hoping to migrate away from ToDoist. I will now stop using tasks and uninstall. Hail ToDoist! 🤗😁🎉🎊 Oh yes, the developer email here is no longer in use 😕

Good app but needs a way to assign priority to tasks. Otherwise you just end up with a long list that contains critical items as well as less important ones all in a big unsorted jumble. The main benefit is that it synchs across devices.

This app is great! I love the "subtasks" feature and how you have the ability to set dates and times for certain tasks. I use for professional and personal use and it has helped me better organize everything in my life.

I like it. However it is not as functional as I need it to be as a quick add to list or add to task. I almost feel like it could be combined all together with Google Keep and Reminders. They all should be one cohesive app.

Great concept, needs improvements. I like because it has nothing superfluous, creating a new task is quite fast. On the down side, many times I don't get the notifications of the tasks, which to me is super important.

I started to use this app as part of a GTD process and have to say it has worked very well. It is very simple and doesn't have any complex features. This is important for the GTD approach and other GTD specific apps have too much. If the app would let me re-order lists I'd give it 5.

I like that it alerts me when I have something to do. But i was hoping that there are more layouts with how you want to see your list. And have a color option and text can be bold. But I'm liking the app so far. Thank you

User interface is extremely basic. There's so much room for improvement. Really wish Google would invest a little on improving the app. That said, I think the tight integration with Gmail and Google Calendar are big advantages.

My tasks involve me going to certain places that i've often never been before inside a time window. I'm finding it a bit clunky bringing in map assets and coersing calendar to represent multi day time windows. Anyhow, mad props to the dev who patched in maps share to tasks. Thanks!
Its my basic memo pad for shopping lists for many years now.
I really like the check animation.
Notification sound must be more strong.

Nice simple app. Would be good if there were a couple more frills, such as more sort options, maybe a way of converting subtasks to tasks (and vice versa) and/or further sublevels... Hence only 4 stars. But still my go-to task manager.

The app allows you to sync your tasks on all devices. It is lightweight which makes it run quickly. The point is to get something that can capture your ideas/tasks as easy as pen and paper. This app comes close.

Simple and does its job. I like the way you can categorize tasks, and adding timing to my Google calendar is a great feature. I wish the tasks showed up on my in-app Calendar, but I think that's more about the calendar app then this one.

Simple and effective. I would like to see the mobile app integrated with google calendar on Android, like it is on the desktop. Otherwise, I find this app very useful for keeping track of lot of coincidening tasks.

Like the fact that it's integrated with the calendar and automatically synced across my devices. The app itself requires a lot of work, and a number of useful options can be added for better managing Todo lists and tasks.

Works well, but extremely limited. Limited options for setting custom recurrence, you can't set alarms/notifications, and there is no composite view where you can see all your unfinished tasks in one place, they are always separated by category. Does not sync properly with Google calendar on iOS dev...Full ReviewWorks well, but extremely limited. Limited options for setting custom recurrence, you can't set alarms/notifications, and there is no composite view where you can see all your unfinished tasks in one place, they are always separated by category. Does not sync properly with Google calendar on iOS devices.

Last time I downloaded Google Tasks I couldn't believe that some important mail had been deleted. Fortunately I had recorded that information on a note pad. I am downloading it again, hopefully this will not happen again.

This app is better than reminders on Android. I would be much happier if I could default to tasks when I ask Google to set a reminder. Started using this app as reminder notifications started to get delayed or just not fire. Not had any of those issues since using Tasks

Easy to use and flexible. I like that you can add sub-tasks to a main task. You can organise the list how you want and you don't have to add a date. I'd like to be able to sort by date but at the minute you organise the list yourself.

Annoying actually to pull up and see the lists. This is the opposite of drop-down but in drop-down you don't have to spend much energy, you just gotta give a push. But here, you gotta use energy to pull up. Not good, man.
So funny, add to tasks from gmail message !
That's exactly what I want from a planner app Thanks Google 😊👍
Have some alram system Or atleast notification before few minutes for reminder of all tasks..

It works, but one thing is really inconvenient: on the widget, it would be nice if the tasks could be ordered in which they appear on my calendar, top to bottom, or if there were options for how they were sorted.l

I am really glad to see Google tasks finally getting attention. One feature that I would like to see is a one button option to schedule a task for today or tomorrow. That is where 90% of my tasks are placed and a one button option for those would cut down on thumb strokes.

This doesn't work anywhere near as well as reminders did in Inbox for GMail. One huge improvement that could be made would be to add a swipe left/right ability to quickly snooze the task. Also an option for tasks to appear in the Gmail inbox would be nice.

I can create a to do list if I don't put a date or time, then set the day and time to work on it. However, I can't set a time to complete or a priority. Ths subtasks have to be dated and timed. They are not automatically within the limits of the main task

Love this app, have been using for awhile now and it is so easy to use, one thing I wish I could do in this app is add multiple appointments on different dates but it is not something that will make stop using the app.

Love the integration w GCalendar and the ability to make separate, custom task categories. Would like: A setting to have sub tasks default to main task's due date. The ability to choose/apply different colors to the task categories. Nice app! I approve!
I liked the overall experience. The app is simple and easy to use. However, there are tons of gaps to be filled, starting with providing chrome extension and so on... Google Keep is better so far!

The app is good but the homescreen widget isn't fit for purpose: it seems to be sorted by task creation date and not due date and there seems no way to change this. You can't see imminently due tasks at a glance (in the widget that is).

1. No Google calendar integration and sync. 2. No way to rearrange Tasks and Subtasks (move individual tasks or stack of tasks with their subtasks). 3. No colour coding option. 4. No tasks priority option. 5. No undo. 6. Confusing with Google Calendar Reminders.

The app interface is very simple and straight forward to understand. There should be more options for users to interested tasks with Google Keep, etc. A good tool but lacks name of the great features in other apps like OneNote and To Do from Microsoft

Love the app. I was previously using TickTick, but decided to switch to Google Tasks. The UI is amazing, although I would love to have a shortcut in the Quick Menu of Android to quickly add a task to Google Tasks without opening the app.

It works well, but I really wish the tasks would show up on my Google calendar app. Creating a task isn't hard, but I wish the default was to add it the day it was created instead of it being set to "no date".

This app is well-designed and easy to use. I put it to use immediately and have been able to organize, prioritize, and complete tasks more efficiently than before. It's also helpful that it appears on my pc as well as my phone. Good job G!
Very helpful being able to change priorities.
Helps me stay organized and integrates well with Google calendar
I use this a lot to keep track of daily tasks.

I can't find the web app. Is it just mobile? I don't want type on my phone. Quick search for google tasks leads me to google calendar - that's not the same in google calendar I see tasks by date. I don't want tasks attached to dates. I just want lists of tasks, I'm also missing "priority" field. I c...Full ReviewI can't find the web app. Is it just mobile? I don't want type on my phone. Quick search for google tasks leads me to google calendar - that's not the same in google calendar I see tasks by date. I don't want tasks attached to dates. I just want lists of tasks, I'm also missing "priority" field. I can reorder by priority, but I still want priority, because I want to reorder by what I want to do next, but I don't want to set dates.

Helps me to get organized. A notification of my past or current tasks in the notification bar helps remind me to take action which is easier than going to launch the app to see pending tasks. I am satisfied so far.

Tasks help me manage my day and track my progress. I like that I can set reminders and enter phone numbers, especially love that a call can be made by just tapping that number when I'm ready to make the call.

I have been using tasks for about 3 years and all the while repeatedly submitting feedback that the list of task lists is in (seemingly) random order with no sort options. At the very least it should be in alphabetical order. Five stars if you fix this.

Would like tasks to sync with Google calendar. It's ludicrous that this is not supported. It's obvious you want to see your tasks in your calendar as you are setting due dates for tasks. This is a must!!!!

It's a great app but it DOESN'T coordinate with the Google calendar. Ideally speaking my tasks should automatically generated/updated on both apps. I use both Google calendar and Tasks but I have to use them separately. Six stars if that happens.

Google tasks is a great app for to-do lists because of it's integration with Google Calendar (for Web) & also because of it's repeating tasks feature. Highly recommended for anyone who wants to invest into the Google ecosystem of apps & services.

Getting better and better. Wish it had a better web interface. And also some prioritization and category features. Sub tasks and multiple lists help with that somewhat, but I still feel like I'm creating workarounds.

Easy to use! Just wish there was another level of subtasks. Also sometimes drag and drop nesting is a little unpredictable on mobile. Generally a great app though. Thank you for creating it. I use it constantly 😂
It's work for all that I want. Is a good app for organize yourself.
Does not integrate with Google Assistant!

It helps me Get Things Done, I love it! Thank you Google Tasks team. On the web side, i would like to have a separate app, rather than having to go into Gmail where I can become distracted by other things.

Great for simple task management across multiple devices. One task per entry, or subtasks under a bigger project, due dates, add details under task title. I wish it integrated more with the Notes app, Gmail, and Google Calendar.

The Tasks app is good but if it could automatically link a sub-task with its task, and share the same date etc. it would be even better over having to do the same thing twice. Also, if the app could please sync to the calendar!

Google's UI is what makes it easy and more creative for us to use these apps for long time. The most productive app for planning and scheduling. However you have to do the work properly in the right time :-)
Incredibly easy, smooth and fast in the use. Great user experience. But I'm not surprised about that, I've personally had the exact same feeling in every other Google App. Love you guys. Thanks!

This app has one really irritating flaw in the UX. When you edit a task, the button position you'd think would be 'save' - bottom right - is actually the button to mark the task as complete. Instead, to save the task you need to use the back button. Please fix!

the app is simple to use, which is nice, but it would be extremely helpful if you could swipe left/right between different lists instead of having to open the menu (which you cannot swipe open) and select a different list every. single. time.

I've used this app for months and it's next to faultless. The only improvement I can suggest is to be able to enter a task and change the category without having to close and reopen. Other than that, it serves all my needs.

App interface is great but it does not have alarms and full screen reminders. Due to this, one has to always open the app and keep seeing it inside the app. The notifications are too small to be noticed. It can have, export tasks as reminders option.
Just what I needed. Easy and efficient.
App doesn't work in landscape on phone or tablet.
Simple, clean, allows me to create simple lists for things like groceries, to-do lists, reminders etc. I can tick off things I've done too. The widget is also fantastic. A MUST HAVE!
I like it. However, I find it difficult to add a reminder from Gmail to Tasks. Sometimes can find the option, sometimes not. I want to seamlessly add a task from Gmail and from Google calendar.

I use this app all the time, primarily for a to-do list but also for a few others. Quick & easy process to add/remove items and switch between lists. My only request would be the ability to share lists between other users +/- shared updating capability.

Easy to use. Main tasks and subtasks that remind you when they are due. Its rewarding to complete tasks. Allows for multiple task sheets and can be accessed on computer or phone at any time. Yes please. I wish there was an option to make titles.

Really good app. The only feature that I think is missing is seeing all the tasks for all your lists in one view. At the moment, you have to switch lists to see everything you're working on for the day.

Helpful but could do a lot more. Would love to have recurring tasks populate each set interval rather than just showing only the next scheduled task. Having categories and dates tasks were marked as completed would also be incredibly useful.

if only there's a way to create hierarchical (indented) outlines.. to better organized by category.. this is major features that Google Tasks missing and need to be implemented in the next update, like MLO have been implement since long time ago...

A good simple app. Being able to nest tasks and have multiple lists is helpful. Wish I could color code tasks, and I dont understand how to make tasks recur. Glad to keep using it though, I'm sure there will be updates.
I suck at traditional "to do" lists. This makes it so easy as I've got it displayed to the side when my Google mail is open. It's convenient and the app on my phone is easy and accessible. A+

Having a widget on screen f to see all tasks is one of basics for thos type of app. But after using quick add (+) whole phone freezes. only way to fix it is to clear recent apps.. going into the app is pointless because you can just a simple notes app instead

Great app for managing tasks list. Wish the reminders were a little more configurable then just days. I'd like for a task to be recurring every few hours and that's not possible right now. Some other features and this'd be an amazing so

This is a no-nonsense app. That does exactly what I would expect. I create a task and it allows me to check it off as it's done, then keeps a list of completed tasks. Perfect for my use. Operates smoothly.
My to-do list of choise. As an app, it's ok but it's missing a browser dedicated page, as we have for the Google Keep. As a workaround, I set tasks through Gmail and then I can see them in the app.

One feature request. I would like to see multiple reminders for a task in a day. I want to set reminders for different times in a day. This feature is missing from most apps and I hoped Google would provide it.
Love this! Specially the integration with gmail
Good, dependable but light.
Always reliable. I can access from anywhere.
Best free app for task management and reminder

Hi guys. The app is good. But to the developers, I have a request in UX. Can you guys add a sorting button to the GTasks widget in android phones home screen? Like the list can be sorted by date or by default by date so that whenever I glance at the widget, I'll know that the one on top will be my n...Full ReviewHi guys. The app is good. But to the developers, I have a request in UX. Can you guys add a sorting button to the GTasks widget in android phones home screen? Like the list can be sorted by date or by default by date so that whenever I glance at the widget, I'll know that the one on top will be my next set of tasks. Thanks. 😊
It is always accessible and super easy to use. Since I adopted a Chronebook, my experience is even better. I always have my list be it on the bus on at my desk...wherever I go!!

Use it every day to jot down things I need to do. Replaces my paper list that I was always losing, sending through the wash, etc. I have two separate task lists. One for tasks, the other I use as a shopping list.
Very useful but we want features like 1. A section that shows which day have I done my task. 2. Last day of the tasks that will help us in terms of reminding how many days we have left.

Task widget for this app applies default sort i.e sort via order. There is no way to specify sort by date in the task widget. Please fix this ASAP! Apart from this, give a feature for templates where if i receive certain type of email which matches the template, it will get added to task automatical...Full ReviewTask widget for this app applies default sort i.e sort via order. There is no way to specify sort by date in the task widget. Please fix this ASAP! Apart from this, give a feature for templates where if i receive certain type of email which matches the template, it will get added to task automatically.
Pretty good and simple. I like simple. The one negative is that I have to access it as a side panel in a browser on my PC. Why can't it stand on its own like it used to and as it does on Android...

This app fits my personal needs very well. I have tried other apps and have landed well with Tasks. Keep is also great for saving things I might want to access in the future or share with my wife. Tasks is all about my day or future plans.
It is a great app. The only issue I have is with repeat items once I select them as done it does not repopulate one for the next month. It is still on my Google calendar just not in the app.

Still learning while using app. But is great for getting things down visually, and free up my mind. I don't feel so overwhelmed all of the time. Still need to learn all it does and how to use it. Need directions & explanations.

The app has served me well for quite a while, and I like its integration with Google calendar. I only wish that I could get it in my mobile work profile, and that it had a better way to mark task priority.
Wish that marked off items would automatically delete themselves
Amazing app, it definitely improves my daily productivity
Very useful and simple!
Sleek and functional in use.

It actually works real good.....but Is there anyway the app can be set to run a program or programs indefinitely, and not just once a day ? If it could run indefinitely until otherwise it would be an excellent application....👍

It's a simple, but works. I still wish there was a dedicate web app rather than just a sidebar in keep/docs/calendar but that's fine. It's not a flushed out as Microsoft To-Do or organized as other task lists but it works.

Good app, but lacks some features like search and more clarity/management options for sub tasks, moving a sub tasks to a new list, removes the master task for example. Also the lists seem a little old fashioned, tags would better allow tasks to have multiple tags assigned .

It's nice app. It can give its better version, if it can *reduce app size, *colors, *different tones(custom) for different group of tasks, *night mode, *direct editing without opening full app, *visible sub-tasks in the list.
Good way to set reminders and tasks. However it lacks the ability to set repeating tasks on the web version. It also lacks a search feature which I think is silly or I have too many tasks...

This is a very solid Todo list app I use quite extensively it's pretty straightforward and integrates with Google calendar. It'd be nice to see easier ways of rescheduling events like swipe to reschedule to tomorrow, categorisation of tasks etc.

This app just works. I use it to manage grocery lists, to check off which of my roommates have submitted their shares for utilities, and to cross of items I'm looking to buy from my various wishlist. A simple, easy to use app that helps with organization for sure

My only complaint is with the widget. I wish I could sort the widget tasks by date and time vs Random order. As it is the widget is mostly useless. Other than the widget, BEST task list for my life that I can find.

I love how simple this app is. For me it's way better than Apple's reminder app. I do wish there was a way to automatically add a calendar event to the list. Maybe there is and I just haven't spent enough time looking.

Amazing app, keeps my work and personal life on track! The only thing I would like to see added, is a way for tasks to be shared to other task users and appear in both list with both users able to collaborate on tasks

Google tasks has helped me organize my day. It sends me reminders to make sure that I take my medications and I use it as a to-do list as well. It's like a more functional version of keep notes for your schedule

I like the app for keeping track of tasks and jobs to come and tracking the repeating tasks and dates they were done in the past. I would like it more if the date showed in past tasks without having to click on it

A simple and clear app for creating to-do's. But I miss the possibility to connect Tasks with Google Calender so I could see both, tasks and events, in Google Calender for more clearness on every day. Just a second button for importing the tasks as reminders in Google Calender.
Excellent for me inspection business and the many emails
Very good app and easy to use.
Good but the event does not sync with google agenda...
Perfect! Do everything I need. Except using Persian calender, maybe I can't set it up.

Perhaps interact directly with your users to refine your products? If you wait much longer, it will be too late... gAssistant is going deaf in installments. You have so many departments it makes my head spin trying to determine what's relevant to my business, if anything. gOne was a great concept till I realized it was limited to "contextual support" avenues that I've usually exhaustively explored before asking gOne for help - $2 is overpriced when the only answer us "email the support link for that feature", a function I can only assume is so wildly successful that staff are too overwhelmed to reply..I am beginning to fear you are too big to succeed. Why do I never get a response to my increasing ire and frustration? I am a thoroughly disappointed ex-fanboy. My clients are not impressed by the growing lack of confidence you've inspired in me. Tl;dr: This app is okay, but lacks some key features such as reminders and improved calendar integration. Long version: I have since long been using a variety of apps for organizing my life. The only problem is that I also like integration between apps. So when I saw that Google - many of the apps I...Full ReviewTl;dr: This app is okay, but lacks some key features such as reminders and improved calendar integration. Long version: I have since long been using a variety of apps for organizing my life. The only problem is that I also like integration between apps. So when I saw that Google - many of the apps I use are by Google (calendar, docs, keep etc.) - I was stoked! I really hoped to finally be able to sync my reminders, to-do's and calendar events without having to have double or even triple sets of everything. As soon as I opened the app, however, I noticed that this would not be possible right away. Some of the problems I have with the app are, in no particular order; -When setting a due date for a task, it is not possible to set a due time for it. This could be solved by setting a start and optional stop time in a calendar event, alternatively have the ability of automatically planning it before the due date/time based on when you are free in the calendar (like the make-time-for-this-function already in calendar). This would also allow for better reminders for the tasks. -Subtasks do not receive a due date (as in, they do not get the same due date as their parent tasks). When sorting by due date, this makes everything look strange. -The first time I launched the app, I had two different lists named "My Tasks" -When completing and "un-completing" a subtask, it will land as a task and not a subtask. Easy to fix afterwards but would definetely become annoying in the long run. -The menu from the bottom-left corner is obnoxious. It would look better if it popped out from the left side instead of from the bottom up. Sure, there may not be too much to show in the menu (yet), but why not put links to other related apps (such as calendar or keep). This would also make it more up to standard with other Google UI:s. Other things I would want that are not that important: -It would be nice to have some sort of sound effect when completing a task, preferrably a choice of different ones (built-in or custom files) in the settings (by the way, where are the settings?). -Add a dark mode for use in the dark. Or, even better, allow us to choose between different themes (:3). -Add a widget for quick access from the home screen. -Add the functionability of recurring tasks (for example, cleaning your room every sunday, or taking the trash out every thursday (See Microsoft's To-Do app for inspiration)). -Add the functionability of working towards a goal (i.e. studying for a test, with the test itself as the due date, and where you can customize how much time you want to spend on the different goals, after which it adds studying sessions to your calendar (fitting it into your schedule)). Okay, time for some positivity! Here's what I already like with the app: -I like the simplicity of the interface. It is easy to understand and quick/efficient to use. -I like the idea of lists. However, categories would also be nice (a sort of tagging system, with fancy colors and descriptions for each category) All in all, it's a nice initiative, but I do believe that more functions along with further optimization is needed for it to become my main app. Thanks.

I've used task lists for years, "you better list-it or you'll miss it" has been my motto after a few camping trips that I didn't have Nutter Butters and Advil. I've used the Google Tasks extension in Chrome for as long as I can remember, so I installed Google Tasks (the app) last week. Right out of ...Full ReviewI've used task lists for years, "you better list-it or you'll miss it" has been my motto after a few camping trips that I didn't have Nutter Butters and Advil. I've used the Google Tasks extension in Chrome for as long as I can remember, so I installed Google Tasks (the app) last week. Right out of the gate there's things that can't be done. Are you one to re-use lists?The app doesn't have a "uncheck all" feature, handy when you need to pull out that camping list again and start ticking through the list. Work around? Yeah, use the Google Tasks extension in Chrome, but I shouldn't have to. You could also install the Taskary app though it's no longer supported by the developer. I also can't find a way to set a default list, you know that camping list I keep harping about? It's my most used list and I have to scroll to get to it. You also can't order your lists alphabetically. Another issue for me is being able to do multiple levels down of nested tasks, it looks like this app only supports two levels; Clothing\Running Gear versus Clothing\Running Gear\Sneaks etc. The app does have a fresh look, functionality is way more important to me and as it stands it's lacking key features.

For example, it would be essential to have a field for deadlines and a f...Full ReviewIts a surprisingly basic and simple list app that syncs across you Google account on your PC and your Android device. That's it. But hey, a lof of important little features can and need be added for this app to deserve 5 stars! For example, it would be essential to have a field for deadlines and a field for priority/urgency for each task, and the ability to sort and filter the tasks according to those fields. For bonus points it would be great if tasks could also be assigned/shared with others.  All of this is standard functionality in other other Google apps so I dont understand why this little app does not have it. Not enough commercial value? I remain hopeful that this is WIP and that Google will provide more features soon.

This is a great first effort for a Stand Alone Task App from Google.  The interface is clean, and it works well with other google apps like GMail and Calendar, but it's missing some features which feel standard, while also not offering anything spectacular.  The whole thing comes off as a big missed...Full ReviewThis is a great first effort for a Stand Alone Task App from Google.  The interface is clean, and it works well with other google apps like GMail and Calendar, but it's missing some features which feel standard, while also not offering anything spectacular.  The whole thing comes off as a big missed opportunity; if you have to use it, I don't think you'll be angry, but for the time being I don't see why you would choose this over the other options.  Pros:  - Google Calendar and Gmail integration - Can add Due Date and Sub Tasks immediately as you're creating a Task (some apps require you to first make the main task, confirm, and them edited the main task to add sub tasks). - Can easily move Main Tasks to become Sub Tasks, and vice versa.  Cons: - Can't reorder lists.  - Can't Create Reoccurring Tasks - Can't add task Reminders, only Due Dates  If they can fix just a couple of the minor complaints Tasks will immediately become one of the best options available.

App is clean and minimal which is great. But for me to use this daily or help with productivity, I will need more features: 1. Time based reminder and snooze option. I want it to keep bugging me till I finish the task. A place based reminder will be even better. 2. Ability to set recurring tasks lik...Full ReviewApp is clean and minimal which is great. But for me to use this daily or help with productivity, I will need more features: 1. Time based reminder and snooze option. I want it to keep bugging me till I finish the task. A place based reminder will be even better. 2. Ability to set recurring tasks like bill payments 3. A way to define default list for loading on app start up or for adding new tasks to, by default 4. Widgets to view tasks or quickly add new ones 5. Integration with Google assistant 6. Adding priority to tasks so that I can sort by priority. 7. Adding labels/ tags so that I can view dynamic lists based on label or tags. 8. Ability to share with or export a list to someone (I know I can use Google Keep for this but makes sense to use just one app) 9. Ability to set rules in Gmail to convert certain mails types automatically into tasks

Basic task list. Can be divided into multiple lists. No prioritization beyond manual sort and different lists. Has due-date feature.  Does not offer location based reminders.  Good integration with GMail.  No integration with Google Keep. No hierarchy of tasks toward a goal (work breakdown structure...Full ReviewBasic task list. Can be divided into multiple lists.
