No hierarchy of tasks toward a goal (work breakdown structure, milestones)  Needs: at least 1, preferably two levels of priority (1 | A; 1 | B) etc.

I have been waiting for a native tasks app from Google for a long time. Previously I was using gTasks. Alarms, task time deadlines and notifications would also help but most importantly I need recurring tasks for this to be truly useful for me.

If this app gave persistent notifications for tasks then it would be perfect. I decided to use this app to create reminders (tasks) that will be in the notification bar to remind me throughout the day until I've completed the task. Unfortunately when I clear my notifications, emails, social media et...Full ReviewIf this app gave persistent notifications for tasks then it would be perfect. I decided to use this app to create reminders (tasks) that will be in the notification bar to remind me throughout the day until I've completed the task. So useless. Not integrated into Calendar and doesn't even exist as a widget. Basically, just a more feature-less and hence useless version of Reminders on Keep. Now, if the entire Reminder system was transferred to Tasks, with, repeating myself, Calendar integration and a widget displaying tasks, as...Full ReviewSo useless. Not integrated into Calendar and doesn't even exist as a widget. Basically, just a more feature-less and hence useless version of Reminders on Keep. Now, if the entire Reminder system was transferred to Tasks, with, repeating myself, Calendar integration and a widget displaying tasks, as well as the ability to perhaps add alarms to tasks, I would very, very happily give this app five stars, and it would be the most productive app I will have used in a long time. Especially considering the eye-pleasing minimalistic UI. But until that happens, keeping it at a generous 2 stars (should really be 1).

Simple. Efficient. Hooks in to Google Calendar (web) and appears on Gmail (web) add-on bar. Great improvements to consider: 1) filter/view tasks across all lists by chosen date in the app. (Also @ the add-on bar app via web) 2) A better notification system (non-configurable other than persistence an...Full ReviewSimple. Efficient. Hooks in to Google Calendar (web) and appears on Gmail (web) add-on bar. Great improvements to consider: 1) filter/view tasks across all lists by chosen date in the app. (Also @ the add-on bar app via web) 2) A better notification system (non-configurable other than persistence and time the new day starts) as currently I get random notifications for # of tasks for the day and at 9a. Make it a proper tracker that shows the # of tasks left that updates with change. Have it show at least the first, maybe a few, task in the top list going down (and possibly with the ability to check off tasks right in the notification! ---- if not, widget would be a pleasant addition). Possibly show alert "incomplete tasks from "xxxx"" in said notification until completed or date change. 3) Collaboration - set per list. 4) *Shows up in Google Calendar app as a "calendar” of tasks just as it shows on website. 5) *if no integration with Google Assistant. Yes, please add that. -For those commenting on non-repeatable tasks: Google calendar. -For those commenting on adding a time: this seems to make sense but it is designed as a simple, clean, and quick Tasker service. Try entering time in item title, in details, or using Google calendar for very important entries. -For those commenting on reminders and other complex notification settings: try Google keep or Google calendar, otherwise either consider a different service or remembering that their are things to do. -For those commenting on too much simplicity/lack of features: this is a simple Tasker app and to make best use of it one should always be aware of. Consider having another service with details/notes/images/complicated items when you need it and using this as a simple check list. Feels good to see these things disappear! -For those commenting on widget: This makes total sense! But a better notification system like above would do a similar job while also keeping things super simple and clean. Looking forward to slight enhancements. (Last app update 6/19/18)

Good start, I hope these features are added soon, will revisit review if they are.

Being a free and concise app is a strong point of google tasks. It is an app with huge potential of killing all competitor apps if google introduces some basic features which are missing. To start with, we should be able to assign times to the tasks, this is a basic requirement which is strangely mi...Full ReviewBeing a free and concise app is a strong point of google tasks. It is an app with huge potential of killing all competitor apps if google introduces some basic features which are missing. To start with, we should be able to assign times to the tasks, this is a basic requirement which is strangely missing till now despite so many online requests towards this on multiple forums. Also calender integration is a must (which comes after time is specified). Also, providing tags will be a plus. Google already has all the components required for this like Google Calender, reminder options etc. I use google bookmarks also where the tags option is beautifully implemented. Its time for google to bring these features in tasks app as well.

I imagine this app -- and the companion web app in the new GMail -- were designed and implemented by an unsupervised group of junior developers.  There are so many bad design decisions and UX atrocities that I don't know where to begin!  Tasks has had multi-level outlines forever.  They *added* *cod...Full ReviewI imagine this app -- and the companion web app in the new GMail -- were designed and implemented by an unsupervised group of junior developers.  There are so many bad design decisions and UX atrocities that I don't know where to begin!  Tasks has had multi-level outlines forever.  They *added* *code* to limit the new version to one level of subtasks.  Then their method of flattening old lists leaves them fairly unusable. And the UI for moving items makes fixing the mess much more difficult than it has to be.  At least they didn't just reformat my lists without asking.  Tab to indent and Shift-tab to unindent are nearly as prevalent as Ctrl-P to print (and worked in the old Tasks web app) but for some inexplicable reason they choose to switch to Ctrl-] to indent and Ctrl-[ to unindent.  I suppose there is some small solace to be gained from them choosing  [] rather than <> or {} so at least we don't have to shift, too.  Why on Earth can't you pop out the web app?!  I've been using Tasks for year and years but there is clearly no option left but migrating all my data to another service.  :-(

No frills and a super simple solution to managing tasks.  This is a product that accommodates many different process' instead of trying to adapt you to it's process. If you're looking for a process to use you can consider my solution. I have multiple lists to manage different parts of my life.  The ...Full ReviewNo frills and a super simple solution to managing tasks.  This is a product that accommodates many different process' instead of trying to adapt you to it's process. If you're looking for a process to use you can consider my solution. I have multiple lists to manage different parts of my life.  The lists I have are: -  "short term" which handles tasks that need to happen this week or next.  As with most software they. With this my process is to look at it every morning and have alerts to ensure they happen - "long term" any projects I hope to get to but I don't have time to fit in to my schedule at this time. Process is look at it once a month and add reminders to things that I need to think about again around that reminder date - "Work" specifically for work tasks and goals - "personal goal" where I document what I'm currently working on to improve myself. Including things like 'read more', 'stay in touch with people', 'volunteer more'   Overall, Tasks is a great tool to accommodate a system you already have in place, but if you're looking for an app to force you into a process this isn't it.

I want to repeat every Sunday afternoon to do home improvement and let the sub tasks be added and checked off but still block that time off.

It's lovely and, while I mostly use Google Keep for note-taking and to-do lists, the simple UI of this app is perfect for the more bare bone work. I do wish that widgets were an option on the phone but the way that this program is integrated into my Chromebook is great.

It need some colours too! That you can change for one block (task + subtask)the colour.  You could also do that some repeats every day, and then you can always watch when you did it and when not, something like habits, habit bull.

It's a great app, with a minimalistic design and simple usability but Iteeds to be integrated in the Google Calendar, have time set notifications, and on screen notifications that remain on screen and disappear only when the task is completed. I hope for some big changes!

I preferred Reminders - how they displayed in the inbox, defaulted to today rather than no date etc. Tasks takes more work to achieve the same. I feel this app was forced on me with the depreciation of the superior product Reminders used to be due to some stupid internal politics.

It works like the old tasks, but with an updated look and feel. Functionality is good enough, but needs a dark theme or something besides the default white.
I like that is a very straight forward app. It does what it describes, list tasks. The interface is very clear and nice to use, without cluttered and unecessary features.

The app is very simple and easy to use. Though some features that I would like a reminder app to have: colour coding, syncing with google calender android, a widget for homescreen. I hope google incorporates that into the app.

Worst Google app ever. It could be useful but it isn't. No customization, can't turn off notification sound, can't open the notification in bar. If I complete a task, it gives a notification, but why? I checked it...

I love the subtasks, notifications, and those things, in addition to the design Still missing: Repeat tasks Share with others the same list of tasks I would like not to have to push the menu button, and be able to slide up to open the menu

Keeps deleting all my scheduled tasks on its own. And then brings back tasks I've completed or edited. It's not worth it to keep starting over & trying to remember everything. I may as well just write a list. At least that won't delete itself.

Ok initial release. No horizontal view on tablets? Fix this please. Use the "GTasks" app as a model. Please add ability to select multiple tasks at once. You can then move all selected to a different day.

I'm really enjoying this app. But I agree on the point that it would be way better to have all these features as a homescreen widget :) Also, if you could add an option to collapse subtasks under the main task, that would be super-awesome!!

Definitely a handy way to note down your daily tasks and is very fast and efficient. However, it would be great if the app supported a widget so that the tasks can always be visible on the home screen Update: 5 months later and still no widget

Friendly UI, simple and convenient to use. This app was the one missing piece to what Google had to offer for productivity! Would love to have functionality to set reminders for tasks and also to integrate tasks into the Google calendars as well !
Works well as a bare bones note app.
It's pretty and fast but very basic. Having a 'Today' or 'Scheduled' tab would be very helpful so I can see all due tasks in one list. Also, add tasks to Google Calendar and retire reminders already.

Useful. Subtask feature is a plus. I have multiple lists & I would like to be able to sort my list names alphabeically. I'd also like to be able to sort my tasks within a list alphabetically sometimes. If I had that feature, it would bump up my rating.

It's a really basic TODO app. It doesn't integrate well with Google's other reminder systems.   As tasks are added, the newest tasks go to the top. This makes the list reversed from the order I entered the tasks. I really like my todo list to be backwards /s.

there is some appeal to this app, the simplicity is delightful but something too simple is annoying. ticktick, another note and tasks application has more features for its free side than this app. little things like, task deadlines, widgets for the home screen and more will make this app appealing.

NAY to Google for changing and abandoning this app. I have been using this app to keep track of bills that need to be paid and now it is impossible to see what is upcoming in the list. You have caused me to miss due dated and that cost me money. Please return this app to its former glory.

One of the best. One of the features I liked is its simplicity. But it is also its weakness as it is too simple it lacks important features is the ability to set a due time not just the date and a home screen widget for Android.
I'm so happy that you guys added the widget feature now! Thank you and keep up the good work in making this all more useful, convenient, and free for everyone.🙏🏻

Simple, but at times too simple. Hey, Google- could you please make an Android widget for Tasks? Being able to view my lists and swipe sideways within the widget to view different lists and check off items would make this app a necessity. Instead, I often forget about it and the lists it contains.
The apps have some problem and feature to improve. Can't delete some task, it will delete all my subtask. And i can't to make task at specific time.

Pretty good app with decent features. Has a clean look. 3 stars because it doesn't have a widget which is a real shame. It really limits its use and productivity.

Also, being able to access lists from any devices is a great advantage. Thanks!

After nearly a decade of using other apps to manage my Google tasks, I've switched. Just needed repeating functionality. Next, get rid of reminders (it's confusing to have both) or just auto add to tasks. Integration with Assistant would be great!

Empty from functions. After having created several tasks in Google Calendar desktop I find out that all my tasks appear without any timestamp, leaving me without being able to plan out an entire day for not knowing when the tasks are set to go off.

Design is good but lacking basic functionality that keeps it from being a reliable solution. Will consider using once Googlr figure out how to choose between googlr assistant reminders, google keep notes, google tasks, etc.

Really great at organizing tasks, can also forward from Gmail, and everything shows up in my calendar when their is a due date. Wish a few more default settings where available and more integration across products, like making an Google Document Action Item a task too.

So far so good. I installed this app after the latest update to both my tablet and phone changed the task list usability in calendering. Only complaint so far is no widget for the home screen so I don't have to open app to see list.

Simple intuitive interface PERFECT for To Do Lists. Works the same on phone or in Goggle Calendar on PC. Super easy to add new Tasks or add new Lists and rename or rearrange things. I hope they DON'T add any bloatware to it.

Missing a lot of features that are in Inbox like recurring reminders, snoozing, mobile notifications, and Google Home integration. Doesn't sync up with Gmail or Keep. Particularly bad since Inbox is getting phased out.

Another Classic Google App. Beautifully designed of course but it seems like a shell of an app: Not as many functions as other to-do apps have (i.e. recurring notifications, location notification). Hopefully it will become a fuller more useful app within the next couple of updates.

App needs to have the option to send push/ persistent notifications in the notifications panel to ensure the tasks/to-do gets done on time. At present one needs to open the app to see the what needs to be done.

reinstalled to see if there was any improvement from initial release. still no integration with existing Google reminders. Google's fragmentation with reminders is hard to believe. doesn't leadership think this is a problem?..

No widget. Can't sync to gCalendar. Cant set a time for when a task is due. Won't send notification on the day a task is due. No priority level... I really hope additional functionality is coming. App is really lacking in current form
The app is really helpful but the only problem is it has got no widgets. If there would have been widgets then it becomes very easy to access your task without opening the app.
Very useful app to stay on track everyday. The only thing i miss is a single view with the tasks from all the lists. Right now I have to switch lists to see my tasks for the day

No repeating tasks, no snoozing, no reminders, no time. If keep app can have all features, if Inbox app can have such features why not this app. I agree with others who need such Features and integration with Google Calendar

It would be great if you can share the list with another google user. It would also be nice to see a date specific task on the mobile app. You can see the tasks in the calendar online but not in the mobile calendar app. Those two things would make this app 10/10

This app works well for your daily tasks but it really should be a part of the calendar app. It would be better if it would at least sync to it. Kind of annoying to have to use 2 apps to plan out my days.

Web app sync perfectly with web calendar but not in mobile calendar if we set task as reminder. This is very important feature I can pay subscription if this works good. Please fix it. (Reduced rating from 3 to 1 star. Because even after 3 months, after many have given same review.)
Best task manage app

Recurring events doesnt appear to work or is at least poorly implemented. Once completed the task is marked completed and only reappears in your tasks list on the day it is due to be completed next so you can't look ahead to see what you have coming up.

Great app, but there is this extremely annoying bug where as I am typing out a task sometimes it just clears what I was typing. I have no idea why it does that but it's driving me crazy because there isn't anything obvious that I might inadvertently be doing that causes it.

Anything that first pops in my mind, goes in Google Tasks first. I use it so much! But just because I cannot search, or share my lists to other apps, which are the most core features that have to be, makes anyone's productivity with app really slow.
Bottom line, it needs Google Calendar integration. Great app aside from that huge flaw of a daily to do listing tool.
This would have been a 5-star app if it had ability to share lists with others. For that, I have to install Google Keep now.
Descent task app, does what it says for the most part, there is room to improve the UX.
It's missing the ability to repeat based on completion date rather than due date.
No complaints. I use it for work. Does what it says.
Should be able to go to list view from widget.
-1 star because calendar view is not present in mobile app
Allows for setting due day and time.

It's too basic and hard to manage tasks. Having a calendar view with summary of tasks for each day would have helped a lot on visualising the tasks and managing them better. I didn't like the whole flow of this app.
Great app for managing tasks. Lacking the feature of sharing a task list with other people.
Not fit for purpose. Syncs data and reverts to it's previous state, wiping all your entries.
Great now dates + times can be set!
Simple and good app
Very simple very good
Need more options on subtasks - sorting, note taking and scheduling
You cannot duplicate lists. Sometimes, for example for a speech, you need to undo everything for do it again. With this app you can't. C'mon Google! Really?
Awful. Doesn't let you do very much in terms of reminding at specific times. You literally have to go into the app to check what needs to be done. Much rather would use Google Keep.
I really like the app. But it definitely needs DARK mode. And i wanted to add date with hours but it only has date picker. It doesnt have it's own widget. It could be cool.

I don't get the hate. The app is supposed to be simple and it's doing a fine job at that. Not to mention it has a very neat design as all Google apps do. SUGGESTION: Enable swiping left or right to move through different task lists.
Much improved than original Tasks that was neglected for a long time. Though, it is a bit redundant, Google keep is a simple similar app with richer features.

OK, but Google Keep is much more intuitive and logical for check box To-Do lists. Keep does lists, notes, reminders, has quick labeling for lookups Been using keep for a while and can't see any reason to switch to Tasks

It would be better if it can be sync to google calendars and vice versa. task to sync to google calendars. since it would be easier to track task and manage daily task in any of the teo productivity app

Doesn't cover reminders?!so seems not in full coordination with calendar.in calendar app reminders are main elements of task managing , but here tasks are, why not cover both in this useful app?or maybe combine them at all..?
I wish this will soon have a pop-up feature --like the one in messenger, so we can check-out or create a new task while we're on a different app or is viewing a site. :)

Utterly useless why ?  Because it only works in bloody portrait mode !!!  It's totally unusable on my Pixel C tablet or any tablet due to a lack of landscape support.   Really Google !?!  Fix your $h!t !!
Basic task list app. There is a lot of potential for improvement. Allowing subtasks to be collapsed into the primary task would be a welcome improvement.
No consistent integration with Google Assistant or Google Calendar on mobile. This app has no real value, yet! If these features are added it will be perfect.
The app is clean. Only a light theme is available. My major hold back is the ability to Share To this app does not exist. It really hampers my workflow. MS ToDo & ToDoist both have this feature.
Great app, but one main issue: Subtasks should group up under their parent task like they do when sorting by "my order" when sorting by date. There should at least be an option for this.

Please add the ability to receive task notification reminders!! It's weird that I can create my tasks in this app, but to be reminded of my tasks I have to make completely separate nofications in my Google calendar. Seems unnecessary! Just add notification integration here.

I like the app and it's concept, but WHY IS THERE NO WIDGET TO PUT MY TASK LIST ON MY HOMESCREEN?!?! Pretty much makes the task list obsolete for me... Bc I keep having to open the app... And it's doesn't remind me about past due tasks either.

Interface and working is good. BUT, nice and informative home screen widget is only BIG missing part of this. I am really waiting for something better innovative and productive compared to other task and reminder apps.

It's good. Wish I could create sub task and have individual due dates for each one. Other than that it works great. Love that it shows up in my calander. Be nice if it did on the calendar app on my pixel as well.

Too keep things short. I love Google, would probably be happy if all my apps were google but I'm giving 3 stars for this because; 1. No option to link it with google calendar 2. No screen overlay bubble to be able to take notes while in other apps

Love how simple this app is.
Very easy to set task, and have copy.

Well, this app from Google seems to be minimalistic and sleek in its interface but that's the only pro I could observe. Just a Basic app, neither provides a widget support nor a reminder. Long way to go.
I like its integration with Google calendar on PC, but as an app this is too simple. May consider making a widget for it, or let it be shown in the widget of Google calendar.
I like the layout but it needs labels as well as folders like Gmail has. I want all my tasks to appear in the my tasks/ homepage as well as in folders/ labels. It also need a pin option.
I love the new user interface and love how I can create subtasks!!  The one thing I see missing is time to be entered next to the day..  that also can be connected to the calendar.

I accidently ticked a task as done and I don't know which it was (whether important it not) and the is no way of undoing the delete. Also no way of asking if the delete to go ahead e.g. a confirmation message. SO annoying and basic!

Great app, But would really use it more if there was widget feature for home screen, for that reason I've still got to use Microsoft todo app, sorry Look forward to seeing an update on this,as mention as well in a previous review

I think Google Task should have a Search Option Because If I Want To Search Something On The Google Task it's currently not available. so I hope you will add this most important feature in the next update.

Can't add recurring tasks, removes existing recurring tasks randomly and is unstable in website. For a multi billon dollar company this app is half assed. There's more things it can't do than it can do.

This is such a bare bones piece of garbage I have to expect it to be shutdown after languishing untouched and unsupported for a year or so. like the simple-ness if the app for my use however it needs a widget that can stay on my screen. I don't always hit the app to open but a having a widget when I'm scrolling through my screens would be so much more helpful.

Amazing, I have lists for work, home, and each kid. As well as a personal and ongoing list. I can invite my partner to see the list so we are always on the same page. 100% recommend!
